events.name: First Code Academy Summer Camps Info Session 2018
events.description:
Learn to think by learning to code.
Know more about First Code Academy's pedagogy and comprehensive roadmap designed for students as young as 4 years old.
Come join us for an Info Session! Learn more about the course content, hear from the instructors, and discover what it means for your child to learn at First Code Academy.Please feel free to let us know if you have any questions in the meantime. Contact us: hellosg@firstcodeacademy.com | 6820 2633 


Shaping Future Creators
First Code Academy is a leading education institute that teaches kids coding courses and develop curriculum for K-12 students to learn not just coding skills, but computational thinking. Our goal is to empower children and teenagers to become creative leaders in the digital era, for their future career and for driving social change.
events.location: First Code Academy, 04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892

events.name: Python 103: Data Analysis
events.description: Let's get together to look into Data Analysis with Pythons most commonly used external libraries: numpy, pandas and matplotlib. Workshop Preparation requisites:• Please bring your own laptop.• Install Anaconda (https://www.continuum.io/downloads) (Python 3 will be used). This will install Python and Jupyter Notebook (http://jupyter.org/), which we will use for our workshop.• Clone/Download Python Tutorial (https://github.com/wwcodesg/python-tutorials) github repository. Agenda:6:30 PM: Registration & Food7:00 PM: Introductions7:10 PM: Python tutorials8:00 PM: Python Workshop8:40 PM: Wrap Up This workshop assumes basic understanding of Python and programming background. This event is open to everyone who is there to inspire women to excel in tech careers. Members interested to help out as workshop assistants:https://goo.gl/forms/oLMX2uSkKDno4Wvy1 All attendees kindly read and abide by the Women Who Code Code of Conduct - https://github.com/WomenWhoCode/guidelines-resources/blob/master/code_of_conduct.md
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: Pizza and Chill (Code) with us!
events.description:
Join us for our first /*pizza & chill {code}*/ night on April 20!
Meet the best of the best engineers from around the world to learn how they were able to solve problems through their work in their respective industries.
It's a casual event, where you will be able to munch on insanely delicious pizza, while also getting the opportunity to learn from some of the top minds behind Singapore's tech scene by listening to their experiences. No path to becoming a successful developer is the same - so if you're looking to start your journey or are simply looking to meet awesome people, this is the place to be on April 20.
MEET THE SPEAKERS 
Jason Choo, Singapore's Prince of Hackathons 
Participant of over 30 hackathons in Singapore and the US, hear what Jason has to say about his experience working with teams from all around the world. If you've participated in hackathons or are looking to jump into the scene, you'll definitely want to hear Jason's inspirational story on how he discovered his passion for developing and hackathons!
Stan Shalom, SGAG's Product Manager 
First tech hire at SGAG and responsible for tech solutions of Singapore's funniest social media company, Stan Shalom will be sharing insights on what to consider when starting development on a project. Failure is often more probable than success when it comes to software development. Learn as he shares his experience on how SGAG’s team approaches problems!
Ivan Choo, Horangi’s Head of Engineering 
With 10+ years experience in building cybersecurity products and currently leading the engineering team at Singapore-based startup Horangi Cybersecurity, Ivan will share his experience working as a software engineer in a company full of hackers and hunters. Gain insights into his team's best practices in secure software development! 
Your FREE ticket covers:
-Exclusive networking with Industry Leaders with expertise in technologies
-First look into top picks of developer job opportunities on Wantedly (and other companies)!
-FREE pizza (how could you say no that?)
-Exclusive SWAG ...and much more!
*For the first TEN attendees to arrive, we will give you an exclusive Wantedly T-Shirt! There are limited seats available, so RSVP now!
events.location: WeWork Beach Centre Level 1, 15 Beach Road, Singapore 189677

events.name: Global Azure Bootcamp - 2018
events.description: Welcome to Global Azure Bootcamp! On, Saturday, April 21, 2018 we are out to set some records again! The story about #GlobalAzure is as unique as it is grand. Each year hundreds of organizers around the globe arrange Azure user group events on the same day. Since the first Global Windows Azure Bootcamp occurred on April of 2013 in 90 locations, it has been a fantastic ride with increasing number of locations each year marching forward! This year we are again doing a one day deep dive class, Hands On Labs to help thousands of people get up to speed on Azure Cloud Services 4 different tracksYour Vision! Your Cloud!! Limited Seats RSVP Today! visit http://singapore.azurebootcamp.net to know more about the speakers & schedules Also make sure you join Microsoft Technical Communities Singapore Facebook group to get latest updates and happening at https://www.facebook.com/groups/MSTechCommunitiesSG More updates on the way, stay tuned! Pre-requisite for Blockchain HOL:1. Azure subscription with access rights to create resources2. Developers should have the following on their machines:3. Visual Studio Code - https://code.visualstudio.com/ This tool is free for Windows/Mac/Linux4. Solidity extension for VS Code: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=JuanBlanco.solidity5. Chrome browser / Firefox Browser and MetaMask extension : https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/metamask/nkbihfbeogaeaoehlefnkodbefgpgknn?hl=en6. Postman: https://www.getpostman.com/7. Link for API dev tools: Azure SDK for .Net and Nodehttps://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/downloads/ Pre-requisite for Azure Machine Learning HOL:1. Microsoft Edge (latest version) Any one of the following browsers2. Internet Explorer 113. Safari (latest version, Mac only)4. Chrome (latest version)5. Firefox (latest version) 6. Microsoft Excel 2010 and above7. Local Admin privilege is preferable Pre-requisite for Azure HOL:Any one of the following browsers1. Microsoft Edge (latest version)2. Internet Explorer 113. Safari (latest version, Mac only)4. Chrome (latest version)5. Firefox (latest version)
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Python 3 programming for beginners (SkillsFuture claimable,with follow up class)
events.description: Guaranteed that you will be able to create Python application after the course. If not you can get a free seat for the next batch, no questions asked. This will be 18 hours course where participants will have 1 week in between the course to reflect the materials and to do exercises using our eLearning platform on http://el.solacetech.com.sg, to be discussed on the follow-up session 1 week after Register here :http://www.solacetech.com.sg/product/python-3-programming-fundamental-and-automation/
